medical_history.chief_complaint: 4-week history of depression with suicidal ideation.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began 4 weeks prior to hospitalization with a gradual worsening. The patient experienced feelings of sadness, guilt, suicidal thoughts, loss of interest, anxiety, early morning insomnia, loss of appetite, weight loss, constipation, feelings of helplessness and worthlessness, and delusional fear of having cancer. There was a specific complaint of being unable to swallow due to a feeling of food sticking in the throat. Symptoms worsened over time, leading to a severe depressive state with significant suicidal risk.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Chronic alcoholism leading to early retirement 2 years before hospitalization.
medical_history.family_history: Family history of affective illness: father had severe depression requiring hospitalization 40 years prior.
medical_history.social_history: Forced early retirement due to excessive drinking.
